intro: Trigonostemon whiteanus, commonly known as the whitean's trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its distinctive tri-lobed leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
